intro: Trachyspermum paktianum, commonly known as Persian cumin, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces oval, brown seeds with a distinctive aromatic scent, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Trachyspermum paktianum thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and culinary uses.
